story.storykicker: The Supreme Court has a strict take on laid back attitude from AICTE's end. Warns AICTE.
story.storybody:
The All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) on Tuesday, May 31, 2016 dealt with Supreme Court's firm acknowledgement of the delay in the starting of academic sessions. The SC also warned AICTE of dire consequences in case it does not adhere to the deadlines marked by the court.

(Read: Workload will not increase for university teachers: UGC )

More about the delay and Apex court issues

  • The council was on the receiving end of the SC warning for the decision on 621 institutes in Uttar Pradesh
  • According to the Apex court, AICTE was expected to have taken a decision on April 10, 2016 which delayed the same till May 15.

What the bench has to say about the issue:

"Don't take us for granted. We would be extremely ruthless to you. We would call your officers and start contempt proceedings. Don't play hide and seek with us. We are not sitting here for nothing," says the bench

 "You change our order every year. How can AICTE tinker with the timeline fixed by us. We are the final authority on this issue. We cannot tolerate defiance of our order and we will take action against officers of AICTE for violating our orders. Let the officers learn a lesson of their life," the bench added.

(Read: "Political Science, the subject talked about the preparation of food," says Bihar Class 12 Arts topper Ruby )

Rules for granting approval by the apex court

  • In 2012, a fixed schedule was finalised for granting approval by the apex court
  • The schedule was fixed not just for the commencement of courses, but also for all that adhered to entrance examinations and admission procedures
  • The SC has also asked AICTE to finish all procedures by July 31 and begin the academic session by August 1.

Supreme Court's end

  • The order by the Supreme Court was passed after a plea from UP's Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam Technical University that was seeking extension of time to grant affiliation due to delay on the part of AICTE
  • Accepting the plea of the university, the bench extended the deadline and directed the university to grant affiliation to technical institutes by June 10.
